metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0146 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The qcow2_open function in the (block/qcow2.c) in QEMU before 1.7.2 and 2.xbefore 2.0.0 allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointerdereference) via a crafted image which causes an error, related to theinitialization of the snapshot_offset and nb_snapshots fields.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0146` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-common - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-user - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-utils - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3').
